column4: Does anyone know how to change a /dev/sdb1 filesystem back into sda? Because it changed for some reason
just use UUIDs
can you tell me how to do that?
why did sda1 becoming sdb1 affect you?  What were you trying to accomplish?
it changed without me doing anything, and now I can't mount the filesystem anymore, so I'm guessing it's because of that. I'm using the livecd now to fix it
the issue is with your fstab?
i'm guessing it is
then just replace /dev/sda1 with UUID=longstringofcharactersthatcomposeyouruuid
where?
in /etc/fstab
if you're not sure the issue is there, then it could be grub
but I can't access /etc/fstab because I can't mount my hard disk
why not?
because I don't know. I think because it changed from sda to sdb
why would that matter?  Just use sdb1 instead of sda1 to mount it
but how?
use a live cd
I am using one right now
I can't check and repair the disk using GParted, it gives me errors
I didn't tell you to, I'm not even sure what that does
normally it makes me able to mount the disk again
so what happens when you try to mount the disk now?  Use a pastebin
